The autogenerated hive-default.xml.template file replaces the variables like ${user.name}, ${HIVE_HOME}, ${var}, ${system:var} etc. and replaces them with actual value. This should not happen for the template file.
Following are the references.
https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/trunk/conf/hive-default.xml.template#L41
https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/trunk/conf/hive-default.xml.template#L46

Can these variables be escaped and not substituted by their actual values? is it a known issue that is addressed elsewhere?

I think we should revert the change until the build issue is fixed. Also, the expansion of the variables in default.xml makes the default.xml not so useful as a reference to the real defaults.
I am planning to revert in few minutes. Please let me know if there are any objections ( I realize that its a short notice, but this is a build issue that warrants immediate attention IMO).

Since the issue appears to only impact hadoop-2 can we hold off for a few minutes while I do some investigation? If the issue is simple to resolve I could generate a patch to fix this in a few minutes.

I was planning to debug the build issue before reverting, but then realized it is two major issues, and that might take sometime to resolve.
Let me know if you have a fix yet for the build issue. If its going to take longer to resolve, it would be better to revert, fix and commit.

I am not sure this patch breaks the hadoop-2. It looks to be broken by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-9908 which is fixed in 2.3. I assume we'd hit that NPE regardless of this change? On the variable resolution front I don't see a simple way to get around that.

In any case, if reverting this fixes the build then I guess we'll have to.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12655439
I have committed this to trunk! Thank you so much Navis!!

Awesome!

Docs needed:

  1. Revise this sentence in the AdminManual Configuration doc: "Please note that this template file is not used by Hive at all (as of Hive 0.9.0) and so it might be out of date or out of sync with the actual values."
  2. Document SHOW CONF. Tests in patch 20 indicate that SHOW CONF takes a double-quoted parameter name and returns the value, value type, and parameter description.
    • Q1: Would single quotes work?
    • Q2: Presumably the value is its current setting, not the default – right?
    • Q3: Can SHOW CONF take a comma-separated list of parameters?
    • Q4: If you don't give a parameter, will SHOW CONF spew out all the parameter settings?
    • Q5: Can you use wildcards, such as SHOW CONF "hive.limit.optimize.*"?

Where to doc:

  • Add SHOW CONF syntax with examples: DDL – Show.
  • Revise one sentence and mention SHOW CONF with link to DDL doc: AdminManual – Configuring Hive.
  • Mention SHOW CONF with link to DDL doc: Configuration Properties.
Its great to have this in finally! Thanks for the perseverance Navis !

Thank to all. But one bad news. Recent commit HIVE-5976 made a little different heading (looks like it's trimmed) for template file. David Chen Could you provide environmental information you're running on? Especially JDK version and vendor.

Thanks for catching this, Navis. I just realized that it looks like the header in the template file in the patch for HIVE-5976 is missing a few newline characters.

When I ran the build that generated the new template, I was running Oracle JDK 7 (Java version 1.7.0_51) on Mac OS X 10.10 Yosemite Beta 3.
Does HIVE-5976 need to patch the template file? (Won't it get generated from HiveConf.java?)
I wonder if we shouldn't put generation of the template file in a profile and make it part of the release process to ensure its up to date.

I wonder if we shouldn't put generation of the template file in a profile and make it part of the release process to ensure its up to date.

I think having a hive-default.xml in trunk that is in sync with HiveConf.java is useful. We can resort to the profile approach as a workaround if we keep hitting into issues of spurious updates to it.
We might consider applying Brock Noland's opinion earlier. Recent patch HIVE-7385 missed updating template and that seemed to be happened virtually on all commits changing HiveConf.

I think having a hive-default.xml in trunk that is in sync with HiveConf.java is useful. We can resort to the profile approach as a workaround if we keep hitting into issues of spurious updates to it.

Agreed, the template file in trunk should match HiveConf.java if possible. But people aren't consistent about updating the template file along with HiveConf.java, and now that all parameter descriptions are in HiveConf.java it seems redundant to update the template file with patches. (I'm sure everyone's tired of me nagging about it and cluttering up the mailing list.)

So could the template file be generated frequently, either on a periodic basis or every time HiveConf.java gets patched?
Is it possible to remove the generated file from source control and depend on the build process to generate it locally? Why must it be committed?
See HIVE-7496.

Doc note: This still needs documentation for SHOW CONF. See these previous comments –

  • Thejas 18/Feb/14 – SHOW CONF examples
  • Lefty 13/Jul/14 – doc questions, where to doc

SHOW commands are documented here:

  • LanguageManual – DDL – Show
This has been fixed in 0.14 release. Please open new jira if you see any issues.

Doc note: This is documented in the wiki (thanks, Navis).

  • DDL – Show Conf
  • Configuring Hive

item.title: [HIVE-6039] Round, AVG and SUM functions reject char/varch input while accepting string input
item.description:
An error similar to the following will occur:

hive> create table tabs (c char(8), vc varchar(10)) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t';
hive> select sum(c), avg(c), sum(vc), avg(vc) from tabs;
FAILED: UDFArgumentTypeException Only numeric or string type arguments are accepted but char(8) is passed.
item.summary: Round, AVG and SUM functions reject char/varch input while accepting string input

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
